title.narrative: OP3: PROGRAMME SUPPORT/PLANNING, M&E

description.narrative: Effective and efficient management of the Education Programme., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national and sub-national Government Ministries and other key stakeholders have improved capacity to implement and monitor inclusive, equitable and quality ECE services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective and efficient management of the Education Programme.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF provided essential guidance to MoES amidst the greatest crisis facing the education sector in decades – the prolonged closure of schools due to COVID-19. UNICEF was instrumental in the safe reopening of schools and heavily supported this process. UNICEF also prioritized continuity of learning via printed materials, education TV and establishment of the first national digital learning platform. The education monitoring system has been strengthened through the development of LESMIS. New research supported by UNICEF has informed education policy dialogue. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/01/2022
